1→{
     2→  "feature": "User Feedback Collection",
     3→  "description": "# User Feedback Collection

Add in-tool feedback mechanism allowing users to rate tool outputs, suggest improvements, and report issues directly from their workflow. Feedback links to specific tool invocations for context.

## Rationale
Known gap - no user feedback collection mechanism. Direct feedback improves tool quality faster than GitHub issues. Lowers barrier to contribution. Enables continuous improvement cycle.

## User Stories
- As a user, I want to rate tool outputs so that I can contribute to quality improvement
- As a user, I want to report issues quickly so that problems get fixed
- As the maintainer, I want user feedback so that I understand what needs improvement

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Thumbs up/down rating available after tool outputs
- [ ] Optional text feedback for detailed suggestions
- [ ] Feedback includes tool name and timestamp for context
- [ ] Feedback dashboard for maintainer review
- [ ] Users can report issues without leaving the tool
- [ ] Privacy policy covers feedback data handling",
     4→  "created_at": "2026-01-06T03:34:51.156Z",
     5→  "updated_at": "2026-01-07T03:31:50.824Z",
     6→  "status": "in_progress",
     7→  "phases": [],
     8→  "planStatus": "in_progress"
     9→}

entries.content:
I've created the implementation plan for the **User Feedback Collection** feature. Here's a summary:

## Implementation Plan Created

**5 Phases with 17 Subtasks:**

### Phase 1: Core Feedback Infrastructure
| Subtask | Title | Files |
|---------|-------|-------|
| 1.1 | Create feedback data interfaces | `src/models/interfaces.ts` |
| 1.2 | Add FEEDBACK to tool names registry | `src/toolNames.ts` |
| 1.3 | Create FeedbackServer class | `src/tools/feedbackServer.ts` |
| 1.4 | Create FeedbackServer tests | `src/tools/feedbackServer.test.ts` |
| 1.5 | Integrate feedback tool into main server | `src/index.ts` |

### Phase 2: Feedback Dashboard API
| Subtask | Title | Files |
|---------|-------|-------|
| 2.1 | Create feedback API route | `web/app/api/feedback/route.ts` |
| 2.2 | Create feedback summary endpoint | `web/app/api/feedback/summary/route.ts` |
| 2.3 | Add feedback lib utilities | `web/lib/feedback/` |

### Phase 3: Feedback Dashboard UI
| Subtask | Title | Files |
|---------|-------|-------|
| 3.1 | Create feedback dashboard page | `web/app/feedback/` |
| 3.2-3.5 | Feedback components | `web/components/feedback/` |

### Phase 4: Privacy Policy & Documentation
| Subtask | Title | Files |
|---------|-------|-------|
| 4.1 | Create privacy policy page | `web/app/privacy/page.tsx` |
| 4.2 | Add feedback documentation | `README.md` |

### Phase 5: Integration Testing & Polish
| Subtask | Title |
|---------|-------|
| 5.1 | Add integration tests for feedback flow |
| 5.2 | Run all tests and verify functionality |

**Estimated Effort:** 8-12 hours

The plan follows the existing codebase patterns where each MCP tool has a Tool definition with schema, a Server class, and interfaces in `src/models/interfaces.ts`.
I'll start by reading the spec and implementation plan to understand the requirements, then look at existing code patterns.
Let me look at the existing interfaces and code patterns in the codebase:
Now I understand the code patterns. Let me also look at how tools are structured to understand the invocation context better:
Now I have a complete understanding of the codebase. Let me implement the feedback interfaces. I'll add them to `src/models/interfaces.ts` following the existing patterns:
Now let me verify the TypeScript compiles correctly:

entries.content:
**Subtask 1.1 Complete ✅**

I have successfully implemented the TypeScript interfaces for the feedback data:

### Changes Made
**File:** `src/models/interfaces.ts`

Added 3 new types/interfaces:

1. **`FeedbackType`** - Union type for feedback categories:
   - `"thumbs-up"` - Positive rating
   - `"thumbs-down"` - Negative rating  
   - `"issue-report"` - Bug/issue report

2. **`FeedbackData`** - Input interface for submitting feedback:
   - `rating: FeedbackType` - Required rating type
   - `comment?: string` - Optional detailed feedback
   - `toolName: string` - Tool being rated
   - `invocationId?: string` - Optional invocation reference

3. **`FeedbackEntry`** - Complete stored entry with all context:
   - `id: string` - Unique entry identifier
   - `rating: FeedbackType` - The rating type
   - `comment?: string` - Optional feedback text
   - `toolName: string` - Tool name
   - `timestamp: string` - ISO 8601 timestamp
   - `invocationId: string` - Required invocation reference
   - `toolContext?: { input?, outputSummary? }` - Optional tool context

### Quality Checklist
- ✅ Follows patterns from existing interfaces (JSDoc, union types, optional fields)
- ✅ No console.log/debugging statements
- ✅ Clean commit with descriptive message
- ✅ Plan updated to "completed" status
I'll implement subtask 1.2 - registering the feedback tool name in the TOOL_NAMES constant. Let me start by reading the spec and understanding the current codebase.

entries.detail:
1→# User Feedback Collection
     2→
     3→Add in-tool feedback mechanism allowing users to rate tool outputs, suggest improvements, and report issues directly from their workflow. Feedback links to specific tool invocations for context.
     4→
     5→## Rationale
     6→Known gap - no user feedback collection mechanism. Direct feedback improves tool quality faster than GitHub issues. Lowers barrier to contribution. Enables continuous improvement cycle.
     7→
     8→## User Stories
     9→- As a user, I want to rate tool outputs so that I can contribute to quality improvement
    10→- As a user, I want to report issues quickly so that problems get fixed
    11→- As the maintainer, I want user feedback so that I understand what needs improvement
    12→
    13→## Acceptance Criteria
    14→- [ ] Thumbs up/down rating available after tool outputs
    15→- [ ] Optional text feedback for detailed suggestions
    16→- [ ] Feedback includes tool name and timestamp for context
    17→- [ ] Feedback dashboard for maintainer review
    18→- [ ] Users can report issues without leaving the tool
    19→- [ ] Privacy policy covers feedback data handling
    20→
